meanings.definition: The belief that all matter is alive and possesses a soul.
meanings.sent1: Hylozoism teaches that everything around us is alive and has a soul.
meanings.sent2: Some ancient cultures embraced hylozoism, seeing life in rocks and trees.
meanings.sent3: In a world of hylozoism, even a pebble might have its own thoughts and feelings.
meanings.sent4: The concept of hylozoism brings a magical quality to the inanimate world.
meanings.sent5: Imagine a universe where hylozoism reigns, and every object pulses with life.

meanings.definition: The philosophical doctrine that all matter is endowed with life.
meanings.sent1: Hylozoism suggests that every particle in the universe is filled with life force.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers debate the implications of hylozoism on our understanding of existence.
meanings.sent3: A playful interpretation of hylozoism could lead to conversations with rocks and rivers.
meanings.sent4: Metaphorically speaking, embracing hylozoism can breathe life into our perceptions.
meanings.sent5: The idea of hylozoism paints a vibrant picture of a living, breathing cosmos.
